verses.roman:
rāghava-ṭhākurera prasāda amṛtera sāra
mahāprabhu yāhā khāite āise bāra bāra

synonyms: rāghava-ṭhākurera—of Rāghava Paṇḍita; prasāda—food offered to the Deity; amṛtera sāra—the essence of nectar; mahāprabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; yāhā—which; khāite—to eat; āise—came; bāra bāra—again and again.
translation: The food prepared and offered to the Deity by Rāghava Paṇḍita was like the essence of nectar. Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu came there again and again to eat such prasāda.
